comment: This professor was so nice and considerate. He allowed extra time for homework if needed and would answer questions about the study guide before the exams or for homework. One of the most flexible professors ever. He really cares about the students./

TAKE HIM FOR CALCULUS. Its a calculus class so its obviously not going to be super easy but hes very great at explaining concepts and helping you get it. His homework is very helpful and he extends deadlines a lot. He also offers A LOT of chances for bonus points. Also his practice exams are also very similar to his tests.

Babak is one of the best professor's I've ever had. He gave so many extra credit opportunities and even though there was a lot of homework, he never had a problem extending the due date. The material is hard but he let us make our own formula sheet for each exam with examples and whatever we needed. I ended up passing calculus with a 106.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I wish I had a professor like him for every math course. He explains concepts very well and answers students' questions in lectures/office hours. I personally didn't need to read the actual textbook much because the lectures and online homeworks taught me everything needed for the exams. Very forgiving with HW due dates. Professor Moazzez is great.

Professor Moazzez was the best. I wish he was always my professor for math based courses. He gave great extra credit and his lectures were easy to understand. If students needed extra assistance he would set up extra sessions one on one. He is a very understanding and caring professor. He made calc an easy and enjoyable course!

If I was to combine every teachers best qulity I've took, they wouldn't come close to Babak. He is absolutely amazing. Decent amount of HW but lots of extensions, extra credit, curves, everyhting you dream of. Man is goated

Okay. There is not a single professor I would take over him. If i was take all the best qualities from every teahcer I've had, it would come close to Babak. Attendance graded, super understanding and flexible, nice guy. Never have thought a negative about him. I got an 58 attendance score and still ended with a 101% because of extra credit. Take hi

Calculus isnt an easy class but this professor makes it amazingly easy! He is beyond understanding and makes sure all his students understand the material. He makes sure everyone has the proper resources prior to tests and gives extra credit to ensure everyone does well. Also super accessible! TAKE HIM!! You will not regret at all.

I LOVE Dr. Moazzez! Anytime I have had a question he has always been super helpful. We are given 10 bonus quizzes that can potentially add an extra 10 points to our final grade. His lectures can be a tad confusing, but as long as you do the homework, pay attention, and ask questions if you are confused you will be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Moazzez is a caring but difficult professor. He was very willing to help students whenever he could with personal meetings. He is very smart and knows the material but he does not make that class easy. Some of his teaching methods make the class harder, in fact. Be prepared for a tough class depending on the material. 3 tests and 1 final.

Dr. Moazzez is pretty reasonable. Sometimes he explains things in an unnecessary convoluted way, but overall he's a good professor. Tests (only 3) and Final are a huge percent of your grade. He gives partial credit, but sometimes takes off for not showing work he wanted even if the answer is correct. 1-2 assignments due a week, but manageable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Moazzez genuinely cares about is students. TAKE HIM. TAKE HIM. TAKE HIM. He gives you clear lectures, and uploads his notes online after class. Gives extra credit opportunities, and actually wants you to pass. He is the BEST math professor at KSU.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: TAKE HIM!

I agree with another comment; he's genuinely one of the best math professors at this university. He is interested in the material, extremely reasonable in his expectations, and really wanting to help each student individually succeed. His lectures are very similar to the (free) book, with a few (important) exceptions. TAKE HIS CLASS.

Unclear grader. Would give some partial credit all semester but the final he didnt, even though he says he did. Same people who made 85-100s on the midterm made 10-20s on the final. His practice final is a huge waste of time. His finals are "cumulative" but thats not true at all. His lectures are usually pretty good though
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: One of the best math professors I've taken at Kennesaw. There are 3 hw assignments, and he's willing to answer questions on the hw. He really wants his students to get the material. No pop quizzes, but he does do a class activity over material learned in that same lecture. Study the practice midterm and final, he based the tests off that.

Attendance and participation are mandatory and goes towards your overall grade. Gives 10% of extra credit at the end of the semester but uses turn it in and if the your copying rate is to high he will not give you the extra credit. Study the study guide and homework for test. Very accessible outside of class. Great Professor!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The professor was consistent in his grading: it's 100% wrong or 100% right. When doing proofs it's easy to have one minor word/symbol out of place, but it'll be counted wrong even if it's a page+ length answer. That combined w/ only homework, mid-term, & final as grading options there's nowhere to pick up extra points for your grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: He is one of the best math professors I have ever meet. His lectures are straight forward and teach from the very basics for better understandings. I don't usually engage in my math courses but this one made me. Finishing the home works on your own pays off later on mid and final exams. Don't take this him if you're looking to get help from the web

He teaches well. Offers extra credit (in class and d2l). Has 12 HW assignments, 2 tests, and a final. I didn't like that he does not assign problems of the same concept (one problem a concept). Also I didn't like that he tricked us sometimes on the test because it was not on the practice test. Most of the time, he's fair.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Moazzez was one of the best math professors I have had here at KSU. He teaches Discrete Mathematics with a more computational perspective, rather than theoretical. He lectures are crystal clear. He has weekly homework which really helps. The tests only have what he went over in lecture and homework and nothing else. There is about 10% extra credit.

He was a GREAT professor. This was my second time taking the class and I was able to understand so much more with him. He teaches the class with a computational approach so it is less mathematical and more programming oriented. I was able to understand the material the first time he explained it in his lectures. TAKE HIM!

Dr. Moazzez did a good job at explaining very complicated topics during lecture. His class was slightly more programming than math heavy. He tries to be as available as possible by offering office hours and skype hours. The book is a free pdf. Take your time to do the homework and review the practice tests and you will get a good grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: It was a very difficult class, but Dr. Moazzez made it understandable. His lectures were very good, with lots of examples and going through step-by-step. He also noticed whenever people were getting something wrong in the homework and would ask to see them outside of class and help them understand it. He really paid attention to everyone.

You will do great if you listen to him and do ALL the homework! There's a homework assignment every week but they really help a ton on the exams. The textbook was used a lot and he gives you a PDF download. Attendance is graded. He goes over the topics in depth in class and makes sure we all understand. He is a great professor and a very nice guy.

He's the type of professor who goes out of his way to help you get as many points possible. The class was challenging, but he did an outstanding job teaching the material so that we could understand it.
